channel.title: [PI] messed up interface
channel.description:
while using an interface editor i removed a few things from interface 962 and it ended up getting messed up...heres the original. [img]http://i1126.photobucket.com/albums/l609/xThaSceneKid/original.jpg[/img]
and heres what happened after i removed the 3 buttons on the top... [img]http://i1126.photobucket.com/albums/l609/xThaSceneKid/messdupp.jpg[/img]
anyone know how to fix that?:S will rep++ the person who can help

item.title: [PI] messed up interface
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

well after all of that, it still comes up nulled -.- any other ideas\suggestions?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] messed up interface
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

This isn’t the best idea ever but probably the only way. Make sure the button isn’t used for anything else important and if not go in your cache and delete the image of that button. Back it up first though. Good luck :3

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] messed up interface
item.dc:creator: @mistakengod mistakengod
item.description:
@mistakengod wrote:

well gl then ;p.

this is my interface :

int textLines = 162;
int[] musicText = {4287, 4288, 4289, 4290, 4291, 4292, 4293, 4294, 4295, 4296, 4297, 4298, 4299, 4300, 4301, 4302, 4303, 4304, 8971, 4306, 4307, 4308, 4309, 4310, 4311};
public static void musicTab(RSFont[] TDA) {
RSInterface Interface = addInterface(29500);
addText(29501, “Playing:”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(29502, “Attack”, 0x33ff00, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
setChildren(3, Interface);
setBounds(29501, 8, 13, 0, Interface);
setBounds(29502, 8, 33, 1, Interface);
setBounds(962, 0, 0, 2, Interface);
Interface = interfaceCache[962];
addText(963, “”, 0xff9b00, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(8934, “”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(6272, “AUTO”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(6271, “MAN”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(9926, “LOOP”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(5450, “”, 0x33ff00, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(4439, “”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addText(3206, “Click the text to construct”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);
addHoverText(4287, “Wall (level 1)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4288, “Table (level 5)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4289, “Spinningwheel (level 20)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4290, “Bank Booth (level 30)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4291, “Chair (level 35)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4292, “Wardrobe (level 45)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4293, “Statue (level 60)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4294, “Fountain (level 70)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4295, “Funpk Portal (level 80)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4296, “bandos portal (level 89)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4297, “Armadyl portal (level 92)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4298, “Saradomin portal (level 95)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
addHoverText(4299, “Zamorak portal (level 99)”, “built”, TDA, 0, 0xff0000, false, true, 150);
}

item.title: [PI] messed up interface
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

what use would that do? it would leave me with the exact same interface…theres no point in doing that…i either need to find out how to edit it and remove everything out of the music list box and keep it from nulling, or find a way to hide the buttons and text outside of the box.

Read full topic

item.description:

well can’t you download the source you used again?
and reset the cache?
take the important files out and set them back later.

item.title: [PI] messed up interface
item.dc:creator: @mistakengod mistakengod
item.description:
@mistakengod wrote:

Ofcourse you can’t delete the buttons because it will change to ‘null’ if you do.
try to get them back. just download the source again and replace the clean interface file

or try to make from this :
addText(6272, “AUTO”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);

this :
addText(6272, “”, 0xFF981F, false, true, 52,TDA, 1);

Read full topic
